title: Iterate Odd Numbers with JavaScript For Loops
content: For loops don't have to iterate one at a time. By changing our final-spression, we can count by even numbers.
We'll start at i = 0 and loop while i < 10. We'll increment i by 2 each loop with i += 2.
ourArray will now contain [0, 2, 4, 6 , 8]. Let's change our initialization so we count by odd numbers.

exercises.instruction: Push the odd numbers from 1 through 9 to myArray using a for loop
placeholder: // Only change code below this line

hint: You should be using a for loop for this
